channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12288] Support DirectByteBuffer usage in DataBlock Encoding area
item.summary: Support DirectByteBuffer usage in DataBlock Encoding area

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12675722/HBASE-12288.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12675722

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of checkstyle errors

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.TestRestartCluster

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/11398//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/11398//artifact/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-rest.html

This message is automatically generated.

Do you not want to use BB in this API as well?

-    protected void createKeyOnlyKeyValue(byte[] keyBuffer, long memTS) {

+    protected void setKey(byte[] keyBuffer, long memTS) {

Does this change not lose fidelity in this context? Is this okay?

-    private TagCompressionContext tagCompressionContext;

+    private boolean tagsCompressed;

Where you have added this comment

+    // result is HBB. So no problem of calling array()/ arrayOffset()

instead consider adding an assertion assert !bb.isDirect()

nit, this comment is difficult to read

+   * Note : This will advance the position in <code>out</code> buffer but no change in position for

+   * the position in <code>in</code> buffer.

I think you mean something like

This will advance the position marker of {@code out} but not change the position maker for {@code in}.

Thanks for the comments Nick

Do you not want to use BB in this API as well?

No. Key is being created, looking at previous state, as a byte[] only.

Does this change not lose fidelity in this context? Is this okay?

Agree this is not in context. I was just doing random in this area and wanted to clean it but missed and went into the patch. I will remove

instead consider adding an assertion

Ok
Ya Ok I will rephrase the comments

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12676267/HBASE-12288_V2.patch
against trunk revision .
